revised_title: Life Cycles and Evolution of Clonal Modular Animals
tldr: This article discusses the complex life cycles and evolution of clonal modular animals, focusing on bottom-dwelling aquatic species such as sponges, hydroids, corals, bryozoans, and ascidians. It explores the multidimensionality of their life cycles, the relationship between individual size and age, variations in reproduction, and the tendency towards philopatric dispersal. The article highlights the importance of understanding the genetic structure of clonal populations and their evolutionary consequences.
